oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate flag
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Seven-star Confederate 1st National flag used at Murfreesboro (Tenn.) when Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest raided the town, July 13, 1862. The Union garrison surrendered the town, an important rail hub, and Forrest destroyed the depot and tracks.; The flag belonged to Capt. Charles Anderson, Forrest's aide-de-camp, who passed it down to his daughter, a member of the United Daughters of the Confederacy, Murfreesboro (Tenn.) Chapter #91.
